snippet: Jean-Claude Brizard will be replaced by Barbara Byrd-Bennett, a central figure in contract negotiations with the teachers.
abstract: Jean-Claude Brizard, head of Chicago's city public schools systems, steps down after only 17 months on the job; shake up comes weeks after Chicago's first teacher strike in 25 years; will be replaced by Barbara Byrd-Bennett, a central figure in contract negotiations to end labor dispute.
lead_paragraph: Jean-Claude Brizard will be replaced by Barbara Byrd-Bennett, a central figure in contract negotiations with the teachers.

headline.seo: Chicago Schools Chief Steps Down After 17 Months
headline.main: Chicago Schools Chief Steps Down After 17 Months That Ended With Teacher Strike
headline.print_headline: Chicago Schools Chief Steps Down After 17 Months That Ended With Teacher Strike
